cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.GT

Reasoning: The problem of bandwidth is a graph theory problem, which falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The algorithm presented in the paper involves constructing bucket decompositions of the input graph, which is a combinatorial optimization technique and falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The algorithm also uses dynamic programming, which is a common technique in computational complexity theory (cs.CC). The problem of finding the bandwidth of a graph is closely related to the problem of graph coloring, which falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). Finally, the problem of bandwidth is also related to the study of graph theory and combinatorial optimization, which falls under the category of graph theory (cs.GT).
